description: A quick, practical guide to OpenStreetMap: Wikipedia for Maps.

buildup.text: OpenStreetMap is a collaborative map built by over 10 million volunteers â€” like Wikipedia, but for geography.

discovery.text: Anyone can edit it. After disasters, volunteers trace satellite images to create up-to-date maps for rescuers.

twist.text: OSM maps parts of Africa and Asia better than Google Maps because local volunteers add roads Google never surveyed.

climax.text: OpenStreetMap proves that open data can be more accurate, current, and useful than proprietary alternatives.

punchline.text: Millions of volunteers built a map better than billions of dollars could.
